#summary pivot - pivots flat-file data from rows to columns

= Usage =

`pivot <options> [file ...]`

-f, -p, and -v values are comma-separated numbers or ranges.  for example:\n\n1,2-5,7

= Options =
||*Short Opt*||*Long Opt*||Arugment||Description||
||-h||--help|| ||print this message and exit||
||-V||--version|| ||print version info and exit||
||-d||--delimiter||<delim> ||field separator string||
||-k||--keep-header|| ||indicates that the first line of input \n\t\t\t\tshould be treated as header info||
||-f||--output-fields||<keys> ||fields to output||
||-p||--pivot-fields||<pivots> ||fields to pivot on||
||-v||--value-fields||<values> ||fields to put into the pivoted cells||
